info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 12:58AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Thomas, southern Sheridan, southwestern Graham and Gove Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1258 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles east of Menlo to 5 miles north of Utica. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Thomas, southern Sheridan, southwestern Graham and Gove Counties, including the following locations... Angelus, Saint Peter and Halford. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 79 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northwestern and west central Kansas.
